channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Can Americans learn to love tiny, cheap kei cars?
item.description: President Trump recently embraced kei cars, tiny vehicles that are popular in Asia but hard to get in the U.S. Kei car enthusiasts are delighted — but...

item.title: How President Trump reshaped capitalism in 2025
item.description: His policies are picking winners and losers — and blurring the lines between business and government.

item.title: Here are some of the NPR stories that had a big impact in 2025
item.description: A sampling of the stories NPR staff believe made some of the deepest ripples this year — reminders of what rigorous, compassionate journalism can do, ...

item.title: Some patients face hurdles getting HIV prevention drugs. Here's what to know
item.description: A daily preventive pill can be invaluable for people at risk for HIV. But some doctors don't know much about prescribing them. And billing headaches a...

item.title: How systemic failures turn state mental hospitals into prisons
item.description: The share of people with severe mental illness in state psychiatric hospitals accused of serious crimes has risen steeply. The shift has all but halte...

item.title: U.S. Coast Guard pursuing third oil tanker off Venezuela coast, source says
item.description: If caught and seized, it would be the third Venezuelan tanker taken by the U.S. this month.

item.title: Russian general killed by bomb under his car in Moscow
item.description: A Russian general was killed when a bomb detonated under his car in Moscow and investigators said Ukraine​ could be behind the attack.

item.title: Thailand, Cambodia agree to talks in bid to end deadly conflict - minister
item.description: At least 41 people have been killed and nearly one million others displaced on both sides, officials said.

item.title: 12/21: CBS Weekend News
item.description: U.S. pursuing another oil tanker near Venezuela; Justice Department pulls down some Epstein files.

item.title: Federal judge to decide whether Kilmar Abrego Garcia should return to immigration custody
At least 1 dead in Redding flooding; 9 rescued from Cisco Grove home
item.description: At least one person has been killed in severe flooding in Redding, the mayor says, and nine people were rescued from a home in Cisco Grove.

item.title: Bondi gunmen 'meticulously' planned attack for months, police allege
item.description: Police release a tranche of documents allegedly tracing the suspects' movements prior to the deadly shooting.

item.title: All pupils kidnapped from Nigeria Catholic school now free - officials
item.description: The authorities confirm the remaining students abducted in Niger state last month have been released.

item.title: Israel approves 19 new settlements in occupied West Bank
item.description: Far-right Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said the move was about blocking the establishment of a Palestinian state.

item.title: Russian general killed by car bomb in Moscow, officials say
item.description: Fanil Sarvarov was the head of the armed forces' operational training department, Russia's Investigative Committee said.

item.title: What are your chances of a white Christmas? Map shows likelihood of snow.
item.description: Northern U.S. states and higher elevations have the best chances of a white Christmas, while southern and western areas are far less likely to see sno...

item.title: Muddy eruption at Yellowstone’s Black Diamond Pool captured on video
Top Trump administration official defends partial release of Epstein files as Democrats cry foul
item.description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche is defending the Justice Department’s decision to release just a fraction of the Jeffrey Epstein files by the con...
